info.game_comments:
First game of Season 29.
New title graphics.
Alex announces special online contestant tests for viewers in Cleveland and Cincinnati markets.

(1, 1).clue: The Chicago River flows out of this Great Lake

(2, 1).clue: This Oscar winner for "Ordinary People" leads a team of thieves & hackers on TNT's "Leverage"

(3, 1).clue: On a clear day, I can see this landmark unveiled in 1923; it's lost 4 letters since then

(4, 1).clue: In Milton's "Paradise Lost", Gabriel sends 2 of these beings to watch over Paradise, & Satan flees

(5, 1).clue: Lapsus linguae, a sudden, unfortunate utterance, translates to this 4-word phrase

(1, 2).clue: In surface area this one of the 5 Great Lakes is the largest body of fresh water in the world

(2, 2).clue: In the 1980s he & his daughter Holly hosted "Ripley's Believe It or Not", though we don't remember any one-armed push-ups

(3, 2).clue: In summer I listen to this great broadcaster, now in his 63rd year calling Dodger games

(4, 2).clue: When Moby Dick is harpooned, this man becomes fouled in the line & is taken under the sea to his death

(5, 2).clue: Said at funerals, requiescat in pace translates to this

(1, 3).clue: The town of Yellowknife is located on the shore of this "Great" Canadian lake

(2, 3).clue: This Oscar-winning daughter of an Oscar-winning director plays producer Eileen Rand on "Smash"

(3, 3).clue: Weekends I go to Musso & Frank's iconic restaurant; GQ called their version of this gin-based cocktail America's best

(4, 3).clue: Chapter 1 of this Tolstoy novel tells us, "Everything was in confusion in the Oblonskys' house"

(5, 3).clue: Agnus dei is this 4-legged animal "of God"

(1, 4).clue: This lake in Oregon is the second-deepest lake in North America

(2, 4).clue: In 2012 this 2-time Oscar winner won a Golden Globe for her role on "American Horror Story"

(3, 4).clue: When I say I live in the Valley, I mean this one that's home to such communities as Studio City & Encino

(4, 4).clue: The oldest of the 3 Musketeers, he was once married to the evil Milady de Winter

(5, 4).clue: In utero means "within the womb"; this other phrase describes something that happens "in glass"

(1, 5).clue: Percy Shelley wrote of this Italian lake, it "exceeds anything I ever beheld in beauty"

(3, 5).clue: Sometimes I get my kicks driving to Glendora to visit the acclaimed Donut Man on this route

(4, 5).clue: Theodore Dreiser based this novel on the case of Chester Gillette, who murdered Grace Brown on Big Moose Lake

(5, 5).clue: i.e. is short for this, meaning "that is"

(1, 1).clue: & I'm here... to remind you... her "Jagged Little Pill" was No. 1 in 1995 & again in '96

(3, 1).clue: George Hepplewhite was known for designing the backs of these in such shapes as hearts & shields

(4, 1).clue: Margaret Hamilton spoke the immortal movie line "I'll get you, my pretty, and" these 4 words

(5, 1).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shows three geometric figures on the monitor.)  A trapezium, a rhombus, & even a kite are examples of this type of planed figure, from the Latin for "4-sided"

(6, 1).clue: A substance used to clean injured skin & to prevent infection

(1, 2).clue: The soundtrack from this movie felt the love tonight (& for 10 weeks)

(3, 2).clue: In the early 20th century, Derrit Rietveld led this country's De Stijl movement, which emphasized abstract furniture

(4, 2).clue: English dramatist John Webster noted, "they that sleep with dogs shall rise with" these

(5, 2).clue: Now would be a good time to remember that it's 1/60 of a degree

(6, 2).clue: It's Italian for Joseph, Mr. Verdi

(1, 3).clue: This Seattle band was "Unplugged in New York"; cuts included "Lake Of Fire"

(3, 3).clue: This London furniture maker popularized his style in his book "Gentleman and Cabinet-Maker's Director"

(4, 3).clue: This Shakespeare play includes the line "Cry 'Havoc!' and let slip the dogs of war"

(5, 3).clue: Don't be dense; tell us this word for an angle of more than 90 but fewer than 180 degrees

(6, 3).clue: A chamber used as a grave

(1, 4).clue: Not afraid to re-dip in previous success, he topped the chart with "Bat out of Hell II: Back Into Hell"

(3, 4).clue: Most of the early work by this N.Y. cabinetmaker whose name sounds like a musical instrument was in mahogany

(4, 4).clue: In 1994, as he left the governorship of New York, he said, "dog eat dog produces... just one dog, and that's a lonely way to live"

(5, 4).clue: The letter m indicates this steepness of a line

(6, 4).clue: The part of a cross-shaped church that intersects the main aisle at right angles

(1, 5).clue: This band's "Monster" album included "Crush With Eyeliner"

(3, 5).clue: Both Alvar Aalto & Charles Eames designed furniture using this layered wood product

(4, 5).clue: An editor of The New York Sun said, "but if" this happens, "that is news"

(5, 5).clue: An assertion that can be proven true, often using axioms & postulates

(6, 5).clue: As its name suggests, this early version of the Old Testament was translated by 70 writers

(0, 0).clue: Of the world's 5 largest islands by area, the 2 with territory of more than 1 country are Borneo & this one
